name: Ext.env.OS
doc:
Provides information about operating system environment.

Should not be manually instantiated unless for unit-testing. Access the global instance stored in Ext.os instead.

members.name: name
members.doc:
The full name of the current operating system. Possible values are:

  • iOS
  • Android
  • WebOS
  • BlackBerry,
  • MacOS
  • Windows
  • Linux
  • Other
members.short_doc: The full name of the current operating system. ...

members.name: is
members.doc:
A "hybrid" property, can be either accessed as a method call, i.e:

if (Ext.os.is('Android')) {
    // ...
}

or as an object with boolean properties, i.e:

if (Ext.os.is.Android) {
    // ...
}

Versions can be conveniently checked as well. For example:

if (Ext.os.is.Android2) {
    // Equivalent to (Ext.os.is.Android && Ext.os.version.equals(2))
}

if (Ext.os.is.iOS32) {
    // Equivalent to (Ext.os.is.iOS && Ext.os.version.equals(3.2))
}

Note that only major component and simplified value of the version are available via direct property checking. Supported values are:

  • iOS
  • iPad
  • iPhone
  • iPhone5 (also true for 4in iPods).
  • iPod
  • Android
  • WebOS
  • BlackBerry
  • Bada
  • MacOS
  • Windows
  • Linux
  • Other

short_doc: Provides information about operating system environment. ...
